message: We are holding 4 town hall meetings on Saturday, February 18. Everyone is welcome. Please join us!
NA

Congrats to Sophie Kartzman from Horseheads Middle School on being named a Distinguished Finalist by The Prudential Spirit of Community Awards!   Sophie is being recognized for her efforts to deliver tens of thousands of holiday cards to military members and veterans, and her ongoing commitment to serving our local communities.

Today we joined with local health care providers and advocates to discuss the importance of the 21st Century Cures Act.   This critical piece of legislation supports the research projects necessary to discover, develop, and deliver life-saving cures and medical treatments.  Please click here to learn more: https://reed.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/reed-protects-patients-families-and-caregivers
NA
We recently met with local health care professionals to discuss proposed policy reforms and gather input about the replacement package for the Affordable Care Act.
We can hold different opinions and still be kind to each other. Here are some pictures from the sit-in and protests at my district offices:

In case you missed the interview on Fox & Friends this morning, here is the clip of my interview on my upcoming town halls. Visit my website reed.house.gov for details. We look forward to a civil conversation and hope to see you there.

It was an honor to meet with President Trump and Vice President Pence at the White House this morning. We had a very productive conversation about working together to solve the issues facing our region, state, and country.
NA

Listening to people is what representation is all about. We may not always agree on every issue, but we are always willing to listen and have a conversation.   Last night, we visited our neighbors from Tompkins County who have been hosting a sit-in at our Ithaca office. I appreciate their passion and commitment to standing up (or sitting-in) for what they believe in.   Despite our differences of opinion on some issues, we had a respectful conversation that allowed us to better understand each other. At the end of the night, we joined hands in prayer for the future of our country.   We even met a few protestors on the way out.   Thank you to everyone who joined us. We look forward to seeing you again soon!
This is a friendly reminder that we are holding 4 town hall meetings tomorrow. We hope to see you there!

My statement regarding my recent visit with the President:  "Our office is a partner to the President on Capitol Hill. This includes speaking with the President candidly about important issues facing our country and pushing forward our agenda to improve the lives of the American people, who I care so deeply about. Things like promoting US manufacturing, reforming our tax code or making college affordable for all, will bring our nation together so all will have the opportunity to succeed. Therefore, I value our relationship with the President and greatly appreciate the President providing me an opportunity to have it."
A few pictures from our first town hall of the day in North Harmony.
In Cherry Creek at our second town hall stop of the day.
Just wrapped up our final town hall of the day in Allen. Thanks to all who came out! I care about your opinions and will always be here to listen.
Hope you are able to tune in to my interviews today with Fox News and MSNBC on our town halls.
Thanks to Morning Joe for having me on to talk about my town halls.  I care about my constituents and will always want to engage in conversation about how to best solve the problems of our nation.
Happy Presidents' Day!
At our annual Valentines for Vets event. I care deeply about veterans and the sacrifice they have made for our county. I will continue to work to make sure that sacrifice does not go unnoticed.

We are in Corning this afternoon addressing the protest. I care about your opinions and will continue to work to find common ground so that we can solve the problems of our country together.

I would like to Thank MSNBC and Fox Business for having me on their networks today to talk about my town halls.   I care about my neighbors in NY 23 and will always work to keep an open dialogue with you.

This evening, President Trump will deliver an address to Congress and the American people.  Please click below to answer our poll question to let us know what issues Congress and the President should prioritize in 2017.

We are pleased to announce that the IRS Taxpayer Assistance Center in Jamestown will reopen today!   Last week, I was informed that the Jamestown office had been closed earlier this year. Our staff immediately began working with the IRS to ensure the office would re-open before the busy tax filing season. As a direct result of these efforts, the IRS agreed to “travel-in” an employee to staff the office.   The office will be open during the following times:  Tuesday:  12:00 - 4:30 pm Wednesday:  8:30 am - 1:00 pm and 2:00 - 4:30 pm Thursday:  8:30 am - 12:00 pm
It was a pleasure to speak with BBC News and Fox Business about President Trump's upcoming speech to Congress.
Thanks to the American Legion and JDRF for stopping by our office. I enjoyed our conversations.

The first women's rights convention, the Seneca Falls Convention, was held in our region in 1848. If you are in the area, be sure to stop by the Women's Rights National Historical Park in Seneca Falls! #WomensHistoryMonth

Here is my statement on President Trump's address to Congress and the American people:  “President Trump called on all Americans to put our differences aside and work together to rebuild our country. Our President gave a sincere speech outlining a bold plan to move our country forward by empowering the American people. We share a common belief that we must strengthen our economy, borders, military, and health care system. I look forward to continuing to work with the President to reignite our economy and the great American spirit.”
Speaking today at the Problem Solvers Conference about working in a bipartisan manner. I care about working together to fix the problems facing our country.
Thanks to the Distributed Wind Energy Association (DWEA) for honoring me with their. "Legislator of the Year" award #distributedwind17
Thanks to the VFW for having me at their national reception. I cannot thank them enough for their service to our nation.
Happy to speak at the rally for the Problem Solvers Conference this morning. As co-chair of the caucus, I will work to gain a consensus in order to find fair solutions to issues facing our nation.

Listening to people is what representation is all about. We care about listening to your thoughts and concerns, which is why we have held more than 200 town hall meetings across #NY23.  Our next round of town hall meetings will take place on Saturday, March 11. Please join us!   https://reed.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/reed-hold-four-town-hall-meetings-across-district

We are delivering on our promise to repeal and replace the #ACA. Click below to read the full text of the American Health Care Act:

We appreciate working with civil protesters to find a common ground on important issues. We hope to see those at our Geneva office today at our town halls this weekend.

After 18 hours of deliberations, the Committee on Ways and Means passed the American Health Care Act.   Here is my statement:  "We have made great progress over the past 24 hours to deliver an important promise we made to people when we said we would repeal Obamacare. I look forward to working with my colleagues in passing fair legislation that will increase access, enhance choice and decrease the cost of health care for working families, children, seniors and all individuals across the country, who I care about deeply."
#TBT in honor of #NOMOREWeek. I am speaking out against domestic violence and sexual assault because there are NO EXCUSES!
Earlier this week, I joined my colleagues at the White House, where we met with President Trump and discussed our efforts to repeal and replace Obamacare.
This is a friendly reminder that we are holding four town hall meetings this Saturday. Please join us!

Our office has received questions about tomorrow's town hall meeting at the Southside Community Center in Ithaca. As with every other town hall, there will be no tickets. We look forward to accommodating all who attend.
Thanks to the Southside Community Center for hosting our town hall in Ithaca today. I will always listen to you and work to find a consensus on the issues facing our country.

Wrapping things up in Pulteney. Thanks to everyone who participated in our town halls today.
Thanks to Finger Lakes Community College for hosting an event on college affordability. I care deeply about making sure everyone has the chance to go to college without accumulating massive debt.

We care about ensuring that all students have the opportunity to reach their fullest potential. It is only right that students have access to affordable education. That is why we are taking action to ensure that colleges offer direct need-based financial aid to students from working and middle class families.   Click here to read our plan: https://reed.house.gov/sites/reed.house.gov/files/Our%20Vision%20for%20Students,%20Final,%2012.2.16.pdf

Here is my statement on the Congressional Budget Office's report on the American Health Care Act:  “The CBO’s estimate confirms that a more patient-centered health care system is finally on the way for hard working American families. These reforms will lower premiums and increase access to quality health care while reducing the federal deficit by $337 billion and taxes by $880 billion. As promised, the American Health Care Act will rescue our collapsing health care system, provide tax relief for middle-income families and business owners, and give Americans the opportunity to save more of their hard earned money. I care about ensuring a stable transition as we fulfill our promise to the American people and deliver long awaited access to truly affordable and sustainable health care.”  Importantly, this report has not factored into plans by Congress and the President to reinvigorate free market competition which will drive costs down even further and open up additional opportunities for flexibility, benefits, choice, and savings.

For too long Albany has pushed its responsibility to fund Medicaid onto local county governments. This shift is responsible for the unreasonably high property taxes in our state. It is time to fix this problem so that younger people stop fleeing our state and the elderly are not unfairly burdened with these taxes http://bit.ly/2mGu7gO

Thanks to the American Council On Renewable Energy (ACORE) for having me at their #REPolicyForum this morning. I am committed to tax reforms and an "all of the above" energy policy.

I care deeply about reducing the property tax burden for people across the region, which is why I support this amendment. These high taxes are hurting our seniors and causing young people to leave the state.   http://www.wrfalp.com/reed-supports-collins-medicaid-amendment-for-proposed-american-health-care-act/

Later this week, the House is expected to consider the American Health Care Act.  Click below to learn more about this bill and the proposed health care reforms. The full text of the #AHCA is available here: https://housegop.leadpages.co/healthcare/#download-bill

This is a critical amendment that will result in many members supporting the #AHCA. We worked tirelessly as a delegation to make this happen. Read more about what the amendment will do to ease the burden on taxpayers here: https://reed.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/reed-leads-county-medicaid-amendment

Today I announced that I will vote in support of the American Health Care Act.   This legislation delivers relief from the taxes and mandates that have hurt job creators, increased premiums, and limited options for patients in #NY23 and across our country. It returns control of health care from Washington back to the states and restores the free market so Americans can access quality, affordable health care options that are tailored to their needs.  The full text of the #AHCA is available here: https://housegop.leadpages.co/healthcare/#download-bill

With the final four this weekend, I wanted to share this bracket. It explains how the richest schools are receiving the most taxpayer subsidies per student. While doing little to lower the cost of attendance. These elite schools have the least number of students from lower income backgrounds. I care about making college affordable for working families, not subsidizing the rich. It is only right that we take a look at where these tax dollars are being spent. We have a plan which would lower the cost of attendance for students from poor and working class families. http://bit.ly/2nrD7WI  (These numbers only look at direct spending and tax free investment income NOT grants or financial aid)

On Memorial Day, it is with great respect and gratitude that we remember and celebrate the men and women in uniform who have made the ultimate sacrifice of giving their lives to protect our freedom. Though we must never forget their bravery, sacrifice and unsung heroism, it is today especially that we lock arms with our fellow Americans to salute them and honor their memory. But beyond the fanfare, we must collectively pledge to protect the causes they advanced in order to make our country and the lives of each and every one of us, more free, more fair and more extraordinarily American.
I was at the Geneva Memorial Day ceremony, today. I was honored to meet with World War II Vets. I cannot thank veterans enough for their service and take the time to honor those who we lost.

We will always remember the tragedy that took the lives of so many in the crash of Flight 3407. We will continue to honor their memory and stand with their family and friends to enhance flight safety regulations. The families of Flight 3407 are tireless advocates who help save lives through flight safety reforms. Because of their commitment Congress passed significant legislation and we will not back down and lessen these important reforms.

Today is the 169th Anniversary of the Seneca Falls Convention that took place in Seneca Falls, NY. It was the first Women’s Rights Convention. The Women's Rights National Historical Park commemorates the Convention each year.   "On July 14-16, 2017, Women's Rights National Historical Park commemorated the first women's rights convention in 1848.  The weekend brought thousands of visitors to Seneca Falls, NY. We look forward to celebrating the national suffrage centennial in 2020," Ami Ghazala, Park Superintendent stated recently.   This is a significant event and we are proud to celebrate the Women's Suffrage movement. It is important to note the historic nature of the Convention and the ties of the movement to our region.

President Trump was wise to articulate a clear policy on South Asia, including a shift in strategy for winning the war in Afghanistan. After the last administration’s disastrous exit from Iraq, I welcome a return to respecting our generals and military experts’ experience in order to extricate us from the quagmire of the last 16 years. The philosophical shift in policy on Pakistan is also significant and I share the president’s commitment to fighting terrorism at its source. We are all witness to the devastation that terrorists bring to our cities and sidewalks and there is no question that I’d much rather hit them there than here.

Day 30/31: We have to make the tax code work for job creators

As a member of the Ways and Means Committee, I am happy to work with President Trump as well as my friends across the aisle to find a consensus when it comes to reforming our broken tax code. We need a simple, fair, and competitive tax code that will allow our businesses to hire and train more workers here, rather than encourage companies to open up shop oversees. Tax reform means hardworking Americans would keep more of their paychecks. We need tax reform.
Day 31/ 31 reasons for #taxreform: No more special interest tax breaks. We need comprehensive reform to help hardworking American families.

I feel compassion for DREAMers who face uncertain futures due to choices not their own. We in Congress should take this opportunity to reform our legal immigration system, not only to find a permanent solution to the plight of these individuals but also to ensure that immigrants can contribute to our society and economy. We must develop policies that create both opportunity and long-term stability for our country as a whole. Comprehensive immigration reform and securing our borders are both necessary to protecting our national interests. This year we have co-sponsored two bipartisan bills that would have a direct and positive impact on DREAMers (Recognizing America's Children Act and ENLIST ACT (Encourage New Legalized Immigrants to Start Training).

We can only hope that the decisive actions of a unified international community will deter Kim Jong Un from this absurd path of self-destruction. I would support maximum sanctions and deterrents deemed necessary to denuclearize North Korea and to ensure the safety of the United States and our allies.
Happy Labor Day! Hope everyone is enjoying the day with family and friends.

It is not fair to hardworking retired Teamsters that their benefits could be cut. There are thousands of retirees who paid into that fund believing their investments would be there for their retirement. It is critically important Teamsters know they must cast an actual vote, as an absent vote will be counted as being in support of the cuts in retirement benefits. Therefore, I encourage all NYS Teamsters to vote by Wednesday’s deadline to ensure their voice is heard!

As we remember all who were lost on this day 16 years ago, let us take a moment to reflect on the unity that each one of their lives inspired in America. It was a day of deep and painful loss, met by the tremendous bravery of thousands of first responders and care givers... a day we will never forget.  It is my hope and prayer that on this September 11th, as we face so much suffering due to natural disasters, we would honor those lost that day with a renewed commitment to help and to heal as one country, one people. As we have proven many times, only together can we overcome the tragedies we face with the true American spirit of tolerance, generosity and bravery.

The bipartisan meeting yesterday at the White House is a refreshing change in atmosphere and a huge step forward for accomplishing real tax reform. The President sent a clear signal that it is time to get this done for the American people. The Problem Solvers Caucus is leading from the House and ready to work with the President on the first significant change to the code in 31 years. By finding common ground and working together we will help American businesses become more competitive and in turn create more jobs for hard working people across the country. By simplifying our code and lowering rates, middle class Americans will be able to keep more of their paycheck in their pockets. This meeting was a significant step forward in finding a consensus in the legislative process. We look forward to working with the President to re-energize the economy and bring much needed relief to America’s middle class.

The time is now to make real reforms to our broken and dated tax code. I am committed to working in a bipartisan fashion in the House, with the White House, and partners in the Senate to find a consensus on tax reform. Today, we have released a framework of our objectives. Our goal is to create good paying, high-quality jobs while cutting taxes for the middle class. This can be done through incentivizing the manufacturing sector and small business growth, as well as lowering rates on businesses and investments. This path will ensure that hard-working folks of our region, and across America, have more money in their pockets. It is time we in DC think outside the box, no ideas are off the table. We need to make substantial reforms so that we have a simple, fair, and competitive tax code.

It was great to see my good friend Congressman Steve Scalise return to the House today. His recovery from the tragic shooting in June is remarkable. We in Congress, now more than ever, need to come together and focus on what unites. We are all here to work on behalf of the American people, regardless of party.

Glad to see HR 2824 (Increasing Opportunity and Success for Children and Parents through Evidence-Based Home Visiting Act) pass the House this week! This bill included reauthorizing the Maternal Infant, and Early Childhood Home Visiting Program as well as our Standard DATA act. Standard DATA will improve data matching within and across programs, increase administrative efficiency and allow caseworkers to spend more time solving problems. Streamlining government is a good thing for taxpayers.

President Obama’s 2015 nuclear agreement with Iran was inherently flawed, dangerous and put American lives at risk. As a result, we have paid Iran tens of billions of dollars in virtually untraceable cash and gold, while Tehran continued to build its nuclear program. Finally, we have a president who is willing to take action against bad foreign actors who abuse human rights and threaten our national security and that of our allies.

I believe a compromise position regarding the state and local tax deduction is achievable. In fact, I have discussed including a credit for state and local taxes which will ensure a tax cut for the hardworking local property taxpayers of New York State. I care about cutting taxes for the middle class. Sen. Schumer and Gov. Cuomo have spent years championing how the wealthy one percent need to pay their fair share; our proposal does just that. As a result, Schumer and Cuomo will be proven to be the biggest hypocrites in New York political history, as they are the ones actually protecting the one percent at the expense of the rest of us.
I’m very comfortable with the compromise of continuing the state and local tax exemption for taxpayers earning up to $400,000: http://bit.ly/2zMr1xT
Read more about how Democrats are fighting to protect the top 1%: http://bit.ly/2i29HwN
My state and local tax plan will protect 99% of people I represent http://bit.ly/2y37Sed
The folks in our region deserve a tax break and that is what I am working to do. http://bit.ly/2y4XLWc cc: Bloomberg Television

Problem Solvers Caucus Co-Chairs Encouraged by CBO Score on Alexander-Murray--   “It is great to see today’s CBO report on the Alexander-Murray proposal showing a reduction to the deficit. It’s a great step similar to the Problem Solvers Caucus framework. Not only will more people have lower premiums, more choice, and lower costs, but the taxpayers will save money. As Co-Chairs of the Problem Solvers Caucus, our proposal provides even more for the American people and mom-and-pop businesses, and we are eager to work with the House and Senate to get it passed.”  cc: Rep Josh Gottheimer

This budget is a critical step towards making reforms to our broken and outdated tax code. We have a once in a generation opportunity to make positive changes that will mean more money for hardworking folks and spark our economy. The American people want and deserve a simpler, fairer tax structure. The time for tax reform is now, so let’s get to it.

With our budget vote I am standing with the 99 percent who will see a tax break with a compromise on the state and local tax deduction. The hardworking people I'm standing with deserve more money in their paychecks and the good paying jobs that tax reform will bring to our region. The Governor's "my way or the highway" approach only illustrates his real intention of worrying about the one percent, even though for years he and other Democrats have called on them to pay their "fair share." It is pure hypocrisy on their part.   cc: Governor Andrew Cuomo

In the end, Governor Andrew Cuomo will be shown to be the true politician he is, a hypocrite who betrays the hardworking people of New York State. With tax reform we have a chance to put money back into the pockets of 99 percent of people across the state. After declaring for years that the 1 percent needs to pay their fair share, it's ironic the Governor has changed his view. Gov. Cuomo's true intentions have been exposed. His top priority is standing with his millionaire and billionaire friends in NYC and protecting those funding his presidential run at the expense of us upstate.

When people get to keep more of their hard earned dollars, it means money for things that make a difference for hardworking people. It’s a down payment on a car for a factory worker in Hornell, daycare for a young family in Elmira, or a trip to Disney World for a family in Dunkirk. Seniors can now visit their grandkids who were forced out of New York because the taxes were "too damn high." This is important to folks throughout the Southern Tier, Finger Lakes, and Western New York. That’s who I’m working for and whose voice I will continue to carry to Washington  #TaxReform

The USDA has awarded rural development loans and grants of over $1.3 million to the Town of Portland as part of the larger North County Water District in Chautauqua County. Enhancing our local economies is a priority of mine and this funding is a major step in advancing the North County Water District. These necessary upgrades to the dated infrastructure will not only provide safe, clean, and accessible water for area residents, but also help attract new businesses to the area. This is a huge win for the Town of Portland and surrounding communities. I am happy to have partnered with our local and state officials to make this project a reality.

We are committed to doing all we can to help create jobs for hardworking people in our region. It is great to see Corning, Inc.’s commitment to our area by creating hundreds of local jobs and good career opportunities. This innovative manufacturing will produce a better type of glass that will help save lives by ensuring glass fragments do not end up in injectable drugs. This is a critical patient safety issue, and I have personally called officials at the Food and Drug Administration to make sure they understand the importance of this new technology. This is big news and a great example of the economic engine we have right here in our backyard.

Today, we will lower taxes so people can keep more of their hard earned money. Tax reform will bring relief to middle and working-class families in New York and across the country. The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act just passed the House. This bill will provide much needed tax relief for working families. By keeping more of their money folks can now take a family trip, make repairs to their car, or save for a rainy day. This historic bill has been seven years in the making. I have been involved in crafting this legislation and fought to lower taxes for hardworking New Yorkers. This is a once in a generation opportunity to reshape our tax code that will bring a new wave of optimism, opportunity, and pride. This is transformative for families in our region.
